marklogic.body:
Very fair write-up Noel.
Taken as a result on a page only, this was a tanking, for sure. If folks watched the whole uncomfortable match, they would be less inclined to snipe about The Academy's quality or progression by default. Â
As in the Spurs match, the kids had enough of the play in the first half to have been comfortably ahead and conceded virtually EVERY chance that created. The club-wide malaise afflicting our players ability to finish is bordering on the comic at this point. That it's extended as far as the penalty-Spot is more unsettling. I make that 9 pens I have seen a Redman miss in regulation time this season across the levels.Â
It's tempting to pour scorn on our much-vaunted 'second-only-to-La Masia' Academy but in Sterling, Adorjan, McLaughlin, Wisdom, Suso et al we have some real prospects for first team duty.Â
Ajax were clinical and wonderfully organised, with several eye-catching youngsters. The final margin of defeat was cruel but not unfair because it was LFC's own failings that meant they were not in contention.Â
A chastening experience for Rodolfo's band of talented kids....
